name: B. Moamen and k-subarrays
statement:
Moamen has an array of n integers. He wants to sort that array in
non-decreasing order by doing the following operations in order : Split
the array into exactly k non-empty subarrays such that each element
belongs to exactly one subarray. Reorder these subarrays arbitrary.
Merge the subarrays in their new order. A sequence a is a subarray of a
sequence b if a can be obtained from b by deletion of several (possibly,
zero or all) elements from the beginning and several (possibly, zero or
all) elements from the end.Can you tell Moamen if there is a way to sort
the array in non-decreasing order using the operations written above?
